intro: Prionostemma aspera, commonly known as rough prionostemma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of branches. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Prionostemma aspera is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
